page.title: 12OAK CLIFF FARM
page.content: Our farm,including all 543.5 acres, is rented from various people.Fields are used for hay and livestock. We have approximately 350 sheep, which graze on the high moors.The dairy cattle numbers range from 50 to 60 and they graze much nearer to home for milking.The cattle numbers are restricted by the milk quota,which is 400,000 litres a year.Nowadays milking is done by machines. We have 3 milking parlours each holding 12 cows.Our cows are predominantly Friesians,occasionally we keep a Jersey. We collect about 50 eggs a day from our hens. Our 8 barns store hay.Usually we cut and bale our own hay.We have a mower, tractor,baler and centipede which shakes the hay out.The finished bales are taken to the barn by trailer.
